page.title: 06BADDESLEY CLINTON:CONVENT
page.content: {The Poor Clares'Convent}was founded in 1850,as a poor house and Franciscan Academy.Later it became a school,which the local Authority took over. There are now 28 nuns,and 1-5 novices (over the age of 20) enter each year. {The building}is Victorian Gothic.In 1983 there was a fire,but the damage has been repaired,largely by the nuns. {The main rule}is the Gospel,but customs have changed through the ages. There is a quiet,carefree atmosphere, and the nuns like to bring out each other's talents. {Their life}is simple.They go barefoot, wearing black headdresses and brown tunics.They have a garden,and are vegetarians.They never buy food, or leave the Convent,if it can be helped. {They have no radio or TV,}unless there is a Coronation or Royal Wedding. They keep cats and dogs as pets.
